Depression Rates by Age Group for Various Countries, 1990-2019

depression_age.Rd

This dataset provides annual data on depression rates for different age groups across countries from 1990 to 2019. It allows analysis of trends in age-specific depression rates over time.

Usage

depression_age

Format

'depression_age'

A data frame with 6420 rows of 18 columns.

Entity

Name of Country

Code

Country Code

Year

Year of Data Collection

Age_5_14

Percentage of respondents aged 5-14 who reported experiencing depression

Age_15_19

Percentage of respondents aged 15-19 who reported experiencing depression

Age_20_24

Percentage of respondents aged 20-24 who reported experiencing depression

Age_25_29

Percentage of respondents aged 25-29 who reported experiencing depression

Age_30_34

Percentage of respondents aged 30-34 who reported experiencing depression

Age_35_39

Percentage of respondents aged 35-39 who reported experiencing depression

Age_40_44

Percentage of respondents aged 40-44 who reported experiencing depression

Age_45_49

Percentage of respondents aged 45-49 who reported experiencing depression

Age_50_54

Percentage of respondents aged 50-54 who reported experiencing depression

Age_55_59

Percentage of respondents aged 55-59 who reported experiencing depression

Age_60_64

Percentage of respondents aged 60-64 who reported experiencing depression

Age_65_69

Percentage of respondents aged 65-69 who reported experiencing depression

Age_70

Percentage of respondents aged 70 and above who reported experiencing depression

Standardised

Standardised percentage of respondents across all age groups who reported experiencing depression

Source

https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/depressive-disorders-prevalence-by-age
